A bit more info:  I _was_ able to successfully add URIs to the crawl
by adding them to the seed list at the bottom of the Settings page.

Rob.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "robeger" <reger@a...> wrote:
> 
> I wanted to see how this worked as a way to inject URIs to a crawl
> that has a lot of inactive threads (like near the end of a crawl where
> there are only a few URIs left to finish crawling from the original
> seed list), so I started a crawl with an original seed list of 4 URIs,
> and 100 toe threads (like I said, this was just to try something), and
> started it.  I let it run for a few mins and then paused it.  Went to
> the View/Edit Frontier page and added a URI from a file, and was
> informed 1 URI was added from it.  Then I resumed the crawl.  Couldn't
> see anywhere that the new URI was getting crawled, queued, or
anything.  
> 
> Am I doing this incorrectly, or is the functionality not there yet?
> 
> Thanks,
> Rob Eger
> Aptas, Inc.
